Motivation.text: Believe you can, and you're already halfway there.
Motivation.author: Theodore Roosevelt

Motivation.text: Push yourself—no one else is going to do it for you.
Motivation.author: Unknown

Motivation.text: Don’t limit your challenges; challenge your limits.
Motivation.author: Unknown

Motivation.text: Everything you’ve ever wanted lies on the other side of fear.
Motivation.author: George Addair

Motivation.text: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
Motivation.author: Theodore Roosevelt

Motivation.text: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
Motivation.author: Arthur Ashe

Motivation.text: Hard days forge the strongest champions.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Keep going. Everything you need will arrive at the perfect time.
Motivation.author: Unknown

Motivation.text: Small daily improvements lead to extraordinary results.
Motivation.author: Robin Sharma

Motivation.text: Dreams don’t work unless you do.
Motivation.author: John C. Maxwell

Motivation.text: Opportunities don’t happen; you create them.
Motivation.author: Chris Grosser

Motivation.text: Start now. Start where you are. Start with courage, even if it feels like fear.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Your only limit is the one you set in your mind.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Don’t stop until you’re proud of yourself.
Motivation.author: Unknown

Motivation.text: Your potential is limitless.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Success comes to those too busy to search for it.
Motivation.author: Henry David Thoreau

Motivation.text: Make each day a masterpiece.
Motivation.author: John Wooden

Motivation.text: Push beyond your comfort zone; that’s where growth happens.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Your future is shaped by what you do today, not tomorrow.
Motivation.author: Robert Kiyosaki

Motivation.text: Wake up with determination, and sleep with satisfaction.
Motivation.author: Unknown

Motivation.text: Don’t wait for inspiration—be the inspiration.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Stop wishing. Start doing.
Motivation.author: Unknown

Motivation.text: Do something today that your future self will thank you for.
Motivation.author: Unknown

Motivation.text: Self-discipline is the foundation of all success.
Motivation.author: Unknown

Motivation.text: Sometimes later becomes never. Do it now.
Motivation.author: Unknown

Motivation.text: The only way to achieve the impossible is to believe it is possible.
Motivation.author: Charles Kingsleigh

Motivation.text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
Motivation.author: Winston Churchill

Motivation.text: Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life.
Motivation.author: Steve Jobs

Motivation.text: The harder the battle, the sweeter the victory.
Motivation.author: Les Brown

Motivation.text: Great things never come from comfort zones.
Motivation.author: Unknown

Motivation.text: It always seems impossible until it’s done.
Motivation.author: Nelson Mandela

Motivation.text: Fall seven times and stand up eight.
Motivation.author: Japanese Proverb

Motivation.text: Don’t watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
Motivation.author: Sam Levenson

Motivation.text: Believe in yourself and all that you are.
Motivation.author: Christian D. Larson

Motivation.text: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
Motivation.author: Winston Churchill

Motivation.text: Courage doesn’t always roar. Sometimes it’s the quiet voice at the end of the day saying, ‘I will try again tomorrow.’
Motivation.author: Mary Anne Radmacher

Motivation.text: Do not wait to strike till the iron is hot; but make it hot by striking.
Motivation.author: William Butler Yeats

Motivation.text: Don’t let yesterday take up too much of today.
Motivation.author: Will Rogers

Motivation.text: You are braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
Motivation.author: A.A. Milne

Motivation.text: Start by doing what’s necessary; then do what’s possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible.
Motivation.author: Francis of Assisi

Motivation.text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
Motivation.author: Mark Twain

Motivation.text: Originality is the art of concealing your sources.
Motivation.author: Arthur Bloch

Motivation.text: Life begins at the end of your comfort zone.
Motivation.author: Neale Donald Walsch

Motivation.text: Original thought comes from doing what others won’t.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Keep moving forward; every step counts, no matter how small.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Energy and persistence conquer all things.
Motivation.author: Benjamin Franklin

Motivation.text: Don’t be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.
Motivation.author: Roy T. Bennett

Motivation.text: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
Motivation.author: Zig Ziglar

Motivation.text: You miss 100% of the shots you don’t take.
Motivation.author: Wayne Gretzky

Motivation.text: Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day in and day out.
Motivation.author: Robert Collier

Motivation.text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
Motivation.author: Peter Drucker

Motivation.text: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
Motivation.author: William James

Motivation.text: Don’t limit yourself. Many people limit themselves to what they think they can do.
Motivation.author: Mary Kay Ash

Motivation.text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
Motivation.author: Walt Disney

Motivation.text: Originality is simply a pair of fresh eyes.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Rise up. Start fresh. See the bright opportunity in each day.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Turn your obstacles into opportunities.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Persistence is the twin sister of excellence. One is a matter of quality; the other, a matter of time.
Motivation.author: Marabel Morgan

Motivation.text: Don’t fear failure. Fear being in the exact same place next year as you are today.
Motivation.author: Unknown

Motivation.text: Small steps every day add up to big results.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: The difference between ordinary and extraordinary is that little extra.
Motivation.author: Jimmy Johnson

Motivation.text: Your mindset determines your success.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Work hard in silence. Let success make the noise.
Motivation.author: Frank Ocean

Motivation.text: Be stronger than your strongest excuse.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Original thinking starts where conformity ends.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Action is the foundational key to all success.
Motivation.author: Pablo Picasso

Motivation.text: Doubt kills more dreams than failure ever will.
Motivation.author: Suzy Kassem

Motivation.text: Do what is right, not what is easy.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Don’t let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do.
Motivation.author: John Wooden

Motivation.text: You are capable of amazing things.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: If it doesn’t challenge you, it won’t change you.
Motivation.author: Fred DeVito

Motivation.text: Success isn’t overnight. It’s when every day you get a little better than the day before.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Original courage is shown by those who rise even when no one is watching.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Your dreams are valid. Chase them relentlessly.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Original strength comes from starting over again and again.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Impossible is just an opinion.
Motivation.author: Paulo Coelho

Motivation.text: Stay positive, work hard, make it happen.
Motivation.author: Unknown

Motivation.text: The best revenge is massive success.
Motivation.author: Frank Sinatra

Motivation.text: Original ambition fuels the soul to achieve beyond the ordinary.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Every day is another chance to get stronger, wiser, and closer to your dreams.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Do it with passion or not at all.
Motivation.author: Rosa Nouchette Carey

Motivation.text: Original greatness is cultivated in the everyday choices you make.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Your journey is yours alone. Own it.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Success is not for the lazy; it’s for the relentless.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Original victories are born from persistence and belief.
Motivation.author: Original

Wisdom.text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
Wisdom.author: Aristotle

Wisdom.text: In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity.
Wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

Wisdom.text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
Wisdom.author: Socrates

Wisdom.text: Do not be wise in words—be wise in deeds.
Wisdom.author: Jewish Proverb

Wisdom.text: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
Wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey

Wisdom.text: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.
Wisdom.author: Jimi Hendrix

Wisdom.text: A wise person knows that there is something to be learned from everyone.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: The fool wonders, the wise man asks.
Wisdom.author: Benjamin Disraeli

Wisdom.text: The simple things are often the truest.
Wisdom.author: Richard Bach

Wisdom.text: Wisdom begins in wonder.
Wisdom.author: Socrates

Wisdom.text: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
Wisdom.author: Aristotle

Wisdom.text: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
Wisdom.author: Aristotle

Wisdom.text: Do not fear mistakes. You will know failure. Continue to reach out.
Wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

Wisdom.text: Wisdom is the reward you get for a lifetime of listening when you'd have preferred to talk.
Wisdom.author: Doug Larson

Wisdom.text: A wise man adapts himself to circumstances, as water shapes itself to the vessel that contains it.
Wisdom.author: Chinese Proverb

Wisdom.text: Education is the kindling of a flame, not the filling of a vessel.
Wisdom.author: Socrates

Wisdom.text: The more I read, the more I acquire, the more certain I am that I know nothing.
Wisdom.author: Voltaire

Wisdom.text: Knowing others is intelligence; knowing yourself is true wisdom.
Wisdom.author: Lao Tzu

Wisdom.text: Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.
Wisdom.author: Plato

Wisdom.text: Experience is the teacher of all things.
Wisdom.author: Julius Caesar

Wisdom.text: The art of being wise is knowing what to overlook.
Wisdom.author: William James

Wisdom.text: Patience is the companion of wisdom.
Wisdom.author: Saint Augustine

Wisdom.text: Silence is the sleep that nourishes wisdom.
Wisdom.author: Francis Bacon

Wisdom.text: A wise man learns more from his enemies than a fool from his friends.
Wisdom.author: Baltasar Gracian

Wisdom.text: It’s not what you look at that matters, it’s what you see.
Wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

Wisdom.text: The only true journey of discovery is not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.
Wisdom.author: Marcel Proust

Wisdom.text: Do not go where the path may lead; go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
Wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Wisdom.text: Original wisdom comes from learning to ask the right questions.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: He who learns but does not think, is lost. He who thinks but does not learn is in great danger.
Wisdom.author: Confucius

Wisdom.text: It is better to remain silent and be thought a fool than to speak and remove all doubt.
Wisdom.author: Abraham Lincoln

Wisdom.text: Original insight grows when curiosity outweighs certainty.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: A wise person listens more than they speak.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: To know when to be generous and when firm, that is wisdom.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Time and patience are the strongest teachers of wisdom.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Original clarity is born from reflection, not reaction.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: The greatest wisdom often comes from the simplest truths.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Wisdom is knowing the right path and courage is taking it.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Original perspective arises when you consider all sides before choosing one.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Do not confuse knowledge with wisdom. Knowledge tells, wisdom asks.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: True wisdom is the ability to live in harmony with change.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: The wise do at once what the fool does at last.
Wisdom.author: Baltasar Gracian

Wisdom.text: Original understanding grows from quiet observation.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Education is not the learning of facts, but the training of the mind to think.
Wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

Wisdom.text: Original knowledge without reflection is like a tree without roots.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Do not judge my story by the chapter you walked in on.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Wisdom is the reward for listening when you wanted to speak.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Original insight often comes from silence and observation.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: He who knows himself is enlightened.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Original strength is knowing when to act and when to wait.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Mistakes are the stepping stones of wisdom.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Original courage is asking questions others are afraid to ask.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: The best way to gain wisdom is through experience and reflection.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Original knowledge is like water—it must flow to grow.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Seek wisdom, not recognition.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Original clarity comes from understanding your own mind.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Do not follow the crowd; let your mind lead the way.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Original insight is the spark of true understanding.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Wisdom is knowing what to hold onto and what to let go.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Original strength comes from enduring what you cannot change.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Patience and reflection turn knowledge into wisdom.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Original understanding grows with empathy and observation.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: True wisdom is balancing the mind, heart, and actions.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Original courage is acting rightly when it’s hard, not convenient.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Wisdom is learning to see the truth beneath appearances.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Original perspective is gained when you step back before you leap.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Wisdom begins with wonder and grows with curiosity.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Original insight is born from questioning everything, including yourself.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: A wise mind is calm in storms and clear in chaos.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Original wisdom listens more than it speaks.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Seek to understand, then to be understood.
Wisdom.author: Stephen Covey

Wisdom.text: Original learning is continuous, never complete.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Wisdom is knowing when to hold your tongue and when to speak your mind.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Original knowledge is most valuable when applied with compassion.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Experience teaches, reflection converts it into wisdom.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Original clarity comes from thinking deeply and feeling honestly.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Wisdom is patience in the face of haste.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Original understanding is seeing patterns where others see chaos.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: True wisdom is measured by how well you act on what you know.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Original insight is recognizing the lesson in every situation.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Wisdom grows when knowledge is tempered by humility.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Original courage is walking the path others fear.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Wisdom is less about knowing and more about applying.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Original reflection transforms experience into enduring knowledge.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: The wise man controls his emotions; the foolish are controlled by them.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Original insight sees opportunity in adversity.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Wisdom is understanding that the journey is as important as the destination.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: Original strength is built through challenges, not comfort.

Discipline.text: Discipline is choosing between what you want now and what you want most.
Discipline.author: Abraham Lincoln

Discipline.text: Success doesn’t come from what you do occasionally. It comes from what you do consistently.
Discipline.author: Marie Forleo

Discipline.text: The pain of discipline is far less than the pain of regret.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.
Discipline.author: Jim Rohn

Discipline.text: What you stay focused on will grow.
Discipline.author: Roy T. Bennett

Discipline.text: Without discipline, there’s no life at all.
Discipline.author: Katharine Hepburn

Discipline.text: Your future is created by what you do today, not tomorrow.
Discipline.author: Robert Kiyosaki

Discipline.text: Small disciplines repeated with consistency lead to great achievements.
Discipline.author: John C. Maxwell

Discipline.text: The secret of success is discipline and persistence.
Discipline.author: Unknown

Discipline.text: Motivation gets you started. Discipline keeps you going.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Discipline is remembering what you want.
Discipline.author: David Campbell

Discipline.text: Self-discipline begins with the mastery of your thoughts.
Discipline.author: Napoleon Hill

Discipline.text: The successful person has the habit of doing the things failures don't like to do.
Discipline.author: Thomas Edison

Discipline.text: Do not let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do.
Discipline.author: John Wooden

Discipline.text: We do today what they won’t, so tomorrow we can accomplish what they can’t.
Discipline.author: Darren Hardy

Discipline.text: The first and best victory is to conquer self.
Discipline.author: Plato

Discipline.text: Discipline is the soul of an army. It makes small numbers formidable; procures success to the weak.
Discipline.author: George Washington

Discipline.text: Mastering others is strength. Mastering yourself is true power.
Discipline.author: Lao Tzu

Discipline.text: He who conquers himself is the mightiest warrior.
Discipline.author: Confucius

Discipline.text: Self-respect is the fruit of discipline; the sense of dignity grows with the ability to say no to oneself.
Discipline.author: Abraham Joshua Heschel

Discipline.text: Discipline is doing what needs to be done, even when you don't want to do it.
Discipline.author: Unknown

Discipline.text: Success is nothing more than a few simple disciplines practiced every day.
Discipline.author: Jim Rohn

Discipline.text: The only discipline that lasts is self-discipline.
Discipline.author: Bovee

Discipline.text: Small disciplines done consistently will yield massive results.
Discipline.author: Robin Sharma

Discipline.text: Discipline is freedom.
Discipline.author: Jocko Willink

Discipline.text: Discipline is the refining fire by which talent becomes ability.
Discipline.author: Roy L. Smith

Discipline.text: Self-discipline is the key to personal greatness.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: The difference between good and great is discipline.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Discipline is doing what must be done, even when it’s uncomfortable.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Consistency is the hallmark of the disciplined.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Original strength is built through persistent discipline.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Discipline is not a restriction, it is a liberation.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: What you consistently do determines your destiny.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Discipline shapes character; character shapes destiny.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Original mastery is the reward of repeated effort.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Without discipline, talent is wasted potential.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Discipline means doing what you know needs to be done, not what you feel like doing.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Your habits determine your outcomes; discipline shapes your habits.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: The foundation of freedom is discipline.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Original focus comes from choosing discipline over distraction.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Discipline is the quiet force behind every great achievement.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Self-control is the true measure of discipline.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Discipline is the ability to make yourself do what you should do, when you should do it, whether you feel like it or not.
Discipline.author: Elbert Hubbard

Discipline.text: Original success is built on the unseen work of discipline.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Discipline is not punishment, it is preparation for greatness.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Discipline is the mother of all achievement.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: The disciplined mind controls the body, the undisciplined mind is controlled by desire.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Original determination is sustained by consistent discipline.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Discipline is choosing the long-term reward over short-term pleasure.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Original commitment shows when no one is watching.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Discipline is doing what you have to do, when you have to do it, whether you like it or not.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Original perseverance turns effort into excellence.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: A disciplined life leads to freedom and clarity.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Original greatness is achieved one disciplined action at a time.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Discipline tames the mind and strengthens the will.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Original focus overcomes distraction and chaos.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Discipline is doing the hard work today so the future is easier.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Original self-mastery is the greatest power a person can have.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Discipline is the bridge between dreams and reality.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Original resilience grows when discipline becomes habit.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Discipline is the difference between goals achieved and goals abandoned.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Original strength is forged in the daily practice of discipline.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Discipline teaches patience, perseverance, and purpose.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Original success is invisible until it manifests through disciplined effort.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Discipline is doing what is necessary, not what is easy.

Discipline.text: Original mastery is cultivated in silence, focus, and repetition.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Discipline is the quiet architect of a powerful life.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Original determination keeps you moving when motivation fades.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Discipline is choosing between comfort now and progress forever.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Original excellence is the outcome of disciplined habits.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Discipline allows freedom within structure.

Discipline.text: Original greatness is earned, not given, through disciplined effort.

Discipline.text: Discipline is the foundation upon which all success is built.

Discipline.text: Original focus is maintaining direction when distractions appear.

Discipline.text: Discipline turns intention into action.

Discipline.text: Original achievement grows where discipline is relentless.

Discipline.text: Discipline is the unseen force behind visible success.

Discipline.text: Original perseverance is acting despite resistance.

Discipline.text: Discipline is the internal compass guiding you toward your highest goals.

Faith.text: Let your faith be bigger than your fears.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: When you do things from your soul, you feel a river moving in you.
Faith.author: Rumi

Faith.text: Faith is taking the first step even when you don’t see the whole staircase.
Faith.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Faith.text: Faith is the strength by which a shattered world shall emerge into the light.
Faith.author: Helen Keller

Faith.text: God has not forgotten you; He’s preparing you.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith does not make things easy; it makes them possible.
Faith.author: Luke 1:37

Faith.text: To one who has faith, no explanation is necessary.
Faith.author: Thomas Aquinas

Faith.text: Faith is seeing light with your heart when all your eyes see is darkness.
Faith.author: Unknown

Faith.text: Feed your faith, and your fears will starve to death.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith is the bird that feels the light and sings when the dawn is still dark.
Faith.author: Rabindranath Tagore

Faith.text: Faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen.
Faith.author: Hebrews 11:1

Faith.text: Let your faith be bigger than your doubts.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Do not let your hearts be troubled; believe in God, believe also in me.
Faith.author: John 14:1

Faith.text: Walk by faith, not by sight.
Faith.author: 2 Corinthians 5:7

Faith.text: Faith is not the belief that God will do what you want. It is the belief that God will do what is right.
Faith.author: Max Lucado

Faith.text: Faith is the strength that enables us to persevere.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: When fear knocks, let faith answer the door.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Keep your faith strong; miracles happen every day.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith is trusting God even when you don’t understand His plan.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Prayer is the key of the morning and the bolt of the evening.
Faith.author: Mahatma Gandhi

Faith.text: Faith sees the invisible, believes the unbelievable, and receives the impossible.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith is not believing that God can, it’s knowing that He will.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith makes all things possible.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith is a knowledge within the heart, beyond the reach of proof.
Faith.author: Khalil Gibran

Faith.text: Have faith in your journey, even when you do not understand it.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith is not the absence of doubt, but the courage to keep going despite it.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: God is within her; she will not fall.
Faith.author: Psalm 46:5

Faith.text: Let your faith be your anchor in every storm.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith is the bridge between where I am and the place God is taking me.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.
Faith.author: Mother Teresa

Faith.text: Faith is believing when it is beyond your understanding.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding.
Faith.author: Proverbs 3:5

Faith.text: Original faith grows when you act on what you cannot see.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith is the light that guides you through darkness.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Do not be afraid, for I am with you.
Faith.author: Isaiah 41:10

Faith.text: Original strength comes when faith outweighs fear.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith is not passive; it is the active force of hope in action.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: God never gives us more than we can handle.
Faith.author: 1 Corinthians 10:13

Faith.text: Original faith is trusting even when the outcome is unknown.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith is the seed; patience is the water; perseverance is the sun.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want.
Faith.author: Psalm 23:1

Faith.text: Original faith whispers when fear shouts.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith does not remove the mountains, but it gives you the strength to climb them.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Cast all your anxiety on Him because He cares for you.
Faith.author: 1 Peter 5:7

Faith.text: Original hope rises from persistent faith.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith is believing in the unseen and trusting in the unseen hands that guide you.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Original courage grows when faith outweighs worry.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith is the inner light that never dims, even in darkness.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Original trust is letting go and letting God.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith is holding on when everything tells you to let go.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Original resilience is born from unwavering faith.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith turns hope into action and dreams into reality.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Original peace comes when faith replaces fear.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith is the compass that directs us through uncertainty.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Original perseverance is continuing when faith tells you to keep moving.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith is the anchor that keeps the soul grounded.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Original inspiration rises when faith meets effort.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith is the oxygen of the soul; without it, life withers.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Original devotion is acting on faith daily.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith transforms despair into hope, fear into courage.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Original clarity comes when faith illuminates the path ahead.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith is the courage to trust the unknown.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Original strength is sustained by steadfast faith.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith allows miracles to take root in the heart.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Original hope is living in trust before seeing results.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith is the light that guides decisions and actions.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Original endurance is fueled by faith that refuses to quit.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith empowers us to rise each time we fall.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Original joy flows from faith in the journey, not just the destination.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith is walking with God even when the road is uncertain.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Original love grows stronger when faith sustains it.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith is the quiet force that moves mountains.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Original courage is stepping forward even when fear whispers 'stay.'
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith is believing that God is at work even when you don’t see it.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Original trust grows when you surrender what you cannot control.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith fuels perseverance, and perseverance fuels results.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Original serenity is found when faith anchors the soul.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith turns the impossible into the inevitable.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Original hope is unshakable because it rests on God.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith is the unseen hand guiding every step.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Original determination rises when faith says, 'keep going.'
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith nurtures patience, and patience nurtures growth.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Original gratitude blooms when faith reminds you of blessings.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Faith transforms uncertainty into a canvas of possibilities.
Faith.author: Original

Faith.text: Original wisdom is acting in faith before the full picture is revealed.
Faith.author: Original

Courage.text: Courage starts with showing up and letting ourselves be seen.
Courage.author: Brené Brown

Courage.text: You are stronger than you think, braver than you feel, and more capable than you imagine.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
Courage.author: Confucius

Courage.text: Courage is not having the strength to go on; it is going on when you don’t.
Courage.author: Theodore Roosevelt

Courage.text: Do not be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
Courage.author: John D. Rockefeller

Courage.text: Be the energy you want to attract.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life.
Courage.author: Steve Jobs

Courage.text: It always seems impossible until it’s done.
Courage.author: Nelson Mandela

Courage.text: Success isn’t final; failure isn’t fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
Courage.author: Winston Churchill

Courage.text: Fear is a reaction. Courage is a decision.
Courage.author: Winston Churchill

Courage.text: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one’s courage.
Courage.author: Anais Nin

Courage.text: Be fearless in pursuit of what sets your soul on fire.
Courage.author: Jennifer Lee

Courage.text: Do one thing every day that scares you.
Courage.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Courage.text: Everything you’ve ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
Courage.author: George Addair

Courage.text: Courage doesn’t mean you don’t get afraid. Courage means you don’t let fear stop you.
Courage.author: Bethany Hamilton

Courage.text: Take risks: if you win, you will be happy; if you lose, you will be wise.
Courage.author: Unknown

Courage.text: It’s not the size of the dog in the fight, it’s the size of the fight in the dog.
Courage.author: Mark Twain

Courage.text: Do not fear failure. Fear being in the exact same place next year.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.
Courage.author: Nelson Mandela

Courage.text: Confidence comes not from always being right but from not fearing to be wrong.
Courage.author: Peter T. Mcintyre

Courage.text: One of the most courageous things you can do is identify yourself, know who you are, what you believe in and where you want to go.
Courage.author: Shea Moisture

Courage.text: Be strong, be fearless, be beautiful. And believe that anything is possible when you have the right people there to support you.
Courage.author: Misty Copeland

Courage.text: You gain strength, courage, and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face.
Courage.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Courage.text: Act as if it were impossible to fail.
Courage.author: Dorothy Broude

Courage.text: Confidence is preparation. Everything else is beyond your control.
Courage.author: Richard Kline

Courage.text: Original courage is stepping forward even when the path is unclear.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Bravery is not the absence of fear, but action in spite of it.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Do not let the fear of losing be greater than the excitement of winning.
Courage.author: Robert Kiyosaki

Courage.text: Original confidence grows when you trust yourself to handle anything.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: The strongest actions for a woman is to love herself, be herself, and shine amongst those who never believed she could.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Courage is like a muscle. We strengthen it by use.
Courage.author: Ruth Gordon

Courage.text: Original bravery is continuing when doubt whispers, 'stop.'
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Confidence is silent. Insecurities are loud.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Original strength is rising each time fear tries to hold you down.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are.
Courage.author: E.E. Cummings

Courage.text: Original daring is embracing the unknown with open arms.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Your courage is your compass in times of uncertainty.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Original boldness is acting despite the odds.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore.
Courage.author: William Faulkner

Courage.text: Original fearlessness is trusting yourself to adapt and overcome.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Confidence is the memory of success.
Courage.author: David Storey

Courage.text: Original audacity is speaking truth even when your voice shakes.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Courage is being scared to death and saddling up anyway.
Courage.author: John Wayne

Courage.text: Original power grows when courage meets persistence.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Fortune favors the brave.
Courage.author: Terence

Courage.text: Original bravery is choosing action over hesitation every time.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Courage is contagious. When a brave man takes a stand, the spines of others are often stiffened.
Courage.author: Billy Graham

Courage.text: Original confidence is quiet yet unshakeable, like a mountain.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: True courage is not reckless; it is disciplined risk-taking.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Original boldness is speaking and acting according to your truth.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Courage is fear holding on a minute longer.
Courage.author: George S. Patton

Courage.text: Original strength is standing firm when the world doubts you.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Confidence is not ‘they will like me.’ Confidence is ‘I’ll be fine if they don’t.’
Courage.author: Christina Grimmie

Courage.text: Original courage is doing the right thing even when it is unpopular.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: A ship is safe in harbor, but that is not what ships are for.
Courage.author: John A. Shedd

Courage.text: Original fearlessness is embracing challenges as opportunities.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Courage is grace under pressure.
Courage.author: Ernest Hemingway

Courage.text: Original bravery is taking the first step when the path is unknown.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Confidence is built on experience; experience is built on courage.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Original audacity is stepping into your power unapologetically.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Courage is doing what you’re afraid to do. There can be no courage unless you’re scared.
Courage.author: Eddie Rickenbacker

Courage.text: Original boldness is moving forward while others hesitate.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: True confidence comes when you are at peace with your own imperfections.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Original strength is believing in yourself when no one else does.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear, not absence of fear.
Courage.author: Mark Twain

Courage.text: Original bravery is acting despite the uncertainty of the outcome.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Confidence is being prepared for the challenge, then stepping in anyway.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Original daring is risking comfort for growth.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Courage is like love; it must have hope for nourishment.
Courage.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

Courage.text: Original confidence is quietly persistent, never boastful.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Bravery is the solution to regret.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Original courage is trusting that you can handle whatever comes.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Confidence is a habit formed by repeated action.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Original boldness is stepping out even when support is not guaranteed.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Courage doesn’t always roar. Sometimes courage is the quiet voice at the end of the day saying, ‘I will try again tomorrow.’
Courage.author: Mary Anne Radmacher

Courage.text: Original strength is knowing you are enough, even before you start.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Courage is the discovery that you may not win, and trying when you know you can lose.
Courage.author: Original

Courage.text: Original confidence is keeping your head up even when the world doubts you.
Courage.author: Original

Happiness.text: Don’t count the days. Make the days count.
Happiness.author: Muhammad Ali

Happiness.text: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
Happiness.author: Dalai Lama

Happiness.text: Be happy for this moment. This moment is your life.
Happiness.author: Omar Khayyam

Happiness.text: Gratitude turns what we have into enough.
Happiness.author: Aesop

Happiness.text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
Happiness.author: Dalai Lama

Happiness.text: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
Happiness.author: Mahatma Gandhi

Happiness.text: A happy soul is the inevitable result of a heart burning with love.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Count your age by friends, not years. Count your life by smiles, not tears.
Happiness.author: John Lennon

Happiness.text: Positive anything is better than negative nothing.
Happiness.author: Elbert Hubbard

Happiness.text: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
Happiness.author: Aristotle

Happiness.text: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success.
Happiness.author: Albert Schweitzer

Happiness.text: Happiness is only real when shared.
Happiness.author: Christopher McCandless

Happiness.text: Happiness is the best makeup.
Happiness.author: Unknown

Happiness.text: Smiles are contagious. Spread them everywhere.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: The most wasted of all days is one without laughter.
Happiness.author: Nicolas Chamfort

Happiness.text: Joy is not in things; it is in us.
Happiness.author: Richard Wagner

Happiness.text: Do more of what makes you happy.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness is a warm puppy.
Happiness.author: Charles Schulz

Happiness.text: Think of all the beauty still left around you and be happy.
Happiness.author: Anne Frank

Happiness.text: Happiness is a journey, not a destination.
Happiness.author: Unknown

Happiness.text: If you want to be happy, be.
Happiness.author: Leo Tolstoy

Happiness.text: Happiness is not by chance, but by choice.
Happiness.author: Jim Rohn

Happiness.text: A cheerful heart is good medicine.
Happiness.author: Proverbs 17:22

Happiness.text: Find joy in the ordinary.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness grows at our own firesides, and is not to be picked in strangers’ gardens.
Happiness.author: Douglas Jerrold

Happiness.text: Original joy is choosing to see the good in every day.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness is letting go of what you think your life is supposed to look like.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Original smiles are the sunrise of the soul.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness often sneaks in through a door you didn’t know you left open.
Happiness.author: John Barrymore

Happiness.text: Original positivity is finding light even in the shadows.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.
Happiness.author: Oprah Winfrey

Happiness.text: Original cheerfulness is a habit, not an accident.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness is a state of activity.
Happiness.author: Aristotle

Happiness.text: Original contentment comes when you stop comparing.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness is a choice, not a result. Nothing will make you happy until you choose to be happy.
Happiness.author: Ralph Marston

Happiness.text: Original joy is appreciating the little things daily.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Count your blessings, not your problems.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Original positivity is the decision to focus on what you can control.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness is an inside job.
Happiness.author: William Arthur Ward

Happiness.text: Original laughter is the music of a contented heart.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
Happiness.author: Marcus Aurelius

Happiness.text: Original delight is choosing gratitude over complaint.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness radiates from the inside out.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Original joy is being fully present in this moment.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness is not having what you want, but wanting what you have.
Happiness.author: Unknown

Happiness.text: Original serenity is finding peace in the present.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness is a perfume you cannot pour on others without getting a few drops on yourself.
Happiness.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Happiness.text: Original optimism is a choice, not a circumstance.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness is loving what you have and being grateful for it.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Original positivity grows when you nurture hope daily.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness is waking up with a grateful heart.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Original joy is sharing small acts of kindness.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness is the natural flower of duty.
Happiness.author: Phillips Brooks

Happiness.text: Original contentment is being at ease with who you are.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness is a choice we make every morning.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Original delight is savoring the ordinary as extraordinary.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness grows when you give without expecting in return.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Original cheerfulness is a quiet rebellion against despair.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness is the experience of living with love and gratitude.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Original joy is the gentle art of noticing beauty in small things.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness is homemade.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Original optimism is seeing opportunity in every challenge.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness is the secret to all beauty.
Happiness.author: Christian Dior

Happiness.text: Original positivity is the courage to keep smiling amidst storms.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness is a choice, a skill, and a habit.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Original contentment is living fully in the moment.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness is not by having what you like, but loving what you have.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Original delight is creating joy for yourself and others.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness is a warm heart, not a full bank account.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Original joy is laughter shared freely and often.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness is the key to a life well-lived.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Original gratitude is the foundation of lasting happiness.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness is embracing simplicity and letting go of excess.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Original contentment is knowing enough is plenty.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness is the light that shines from within.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Original positivity is choosing hope over despair every day.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness is a reflection of inner peace.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Original joy is finding delight in your own company.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness is living with a heart wide open.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Original laughter is medicine for the soul.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness is the art of being grateful in every season.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Original cheerfulness is a daily practice, not an occasional event.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness is seeing the good in yourself and others.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Original delight is allowing small pleasures to brighten your day.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness is choosing joy in spite of challenges.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Original optimism is lighting your own path even when the world is dark.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Happiness is the music of a grateful heart.
Happiness.author: Original

Happiness.text: Original joy is nurturing kindness, laughter, and love daily.
Happiness.author: Original

African.text: Wisdom does not come overnight.
African.author: Somali Proverb

African.text: If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Rain does not fall on one roof alone.
African.author: Cameroonian Proverb

African.text: A bird does not change its feathers because the weather is bad.
African.author: Nigerian Proverb

African.text: When the roots are deep, there is no reason to fear the wind.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: A child who is not embraced by the village will burn it down to feel its warmth.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Knowledge is like a garden; if it is not cultivated, it cannot be harvested.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: No matter how long the night, the day is sure to come.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: A roaring lion kills no game.
African.author: Ugandan Proverb

African.text: When two elephants fight, it is the grass that suffers.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: He who learns, teaches.
African.author: Ethiopian Proverb

African.text: Unity is strength, division is weakness.
African.author: Swahili Proverb

African.text: Even the best cooking pot will not produce food.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Money can’t talk, yet it can make lies look true.
African.author: South African Proverb

African.text: A man who uses force is afraid of reasoning.
African.author: Kenyan Proverb

African.text: Do not look where you fell, but where you slipped.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Wisdom is like a baobab tree; no one individual can embrace it.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: A wise man never knows all, only fools know everything.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: If the lion doesn’t tell his story, the hunter will.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Even the best dancer on the stage must retire sometime.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: The child who is not taught by its parents will be taught by the world.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: No medicine can cure what happiness cannot.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: He who does not know one thing knows another.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Patience can cook a stone.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Wisdom is wealth; spend it carefully.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: Even the best sword cannot cut a tree without effort.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: The eyes of the future are looking at us and they are praying for us to see beyond ourselves.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: A river does not flow backward.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Do not set sail using someone else’s star.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: A bird will always use another bird’s feathers to fly.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: He who does not listen to advice will be beaten by experience.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: The child who asks questions never becomes a fool.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: Even the lion protects itself against flies.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Do not bite the hand that feeds you.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: The mouth that eats does not talk.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: A single bracelet does not jingle.
African.author: Congolese Proverb

African.text: The person who loves you will make you feel it.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: Even the small leopard can leave its mark.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: No one tests the depth of a river until they step in.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: A family tie is like a tree, it can bend but it will not break.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: If you climb up a tree, you must climb down the same tree.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Do not follow the path. Go where there is no path and begin the trail.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Even a small thorn causes pain.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: A frog does not drink up the pond in which it lives.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: When a king has good counselors, his reign is peaceful.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Original cultural wisdom: Respect for elders is the root of harmony in the village.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: Even the small bird can see what the eagle cannot.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: A child who is loved by the village learns patience and courage.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: He who digs a pit for others falls into it himself.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: The mouth does not eat if the feet do not walk.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Wisdom does not reside in one mouth alone.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Original African insight: Courage is born when fear is faced together.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: When a tree falls, the monkeys scatter.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Even the strongest among us is tempered by the storm.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: A man who asks is a fool for five minutes, but a man who does not ask remains a fool forever.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: One does not sell the spear that kills the enemy.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Original cultural wisdom: A community thrives when its stories are shared.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: Even the tortoise can reach the other side of the river.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: If you think you are too small to make a difference, you haven’t spent the night with a mosquito.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: A person who never travels thinks his mother is the best cook.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Original African reflection: Patience is the thread that sews the fabric of life.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: Even a monkey falls from the tree.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: A man who counts the stars cannot count his blessings.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: The child who learns from the forest will never fear the dark.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: A man does not remove a mountain with one blow.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Original wisdom: Respect for nature ensures survival of all.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: The one who is asked the question knows less than the one who asks it.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Even a small drum can awaken the village.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Original reflection: Listening to elders is drinking from the river of experience.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: No one grooms the goat by shouting at it.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: He who hides his illness cannot be helped.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Original wisdom: The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step, taken with care.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: A child’s tears water the roots of compassion.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: Even the tallest tree started as a seed.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Do not look for the enemy under your own bed.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Original African reflection: Courage is not the absence of fear but the resolve to act.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: Even the best cooking pot will not produce food without fire.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Original wisdom: Patience and perseverance can turn sand into stone.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: The strength of the crocodile is in the water.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Original reflection: A wise heart listens before it speaks.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: No one can whistle a symphony. It takes a whole orchestra.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Original African wisdom: Family and community are the pillars of resilience.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: Even the sharpest knife cannot cut without a hand to wield it.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: A person who believes in tomorrow works today.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: Original reflection: The child who dances learns the rhythm of life.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: Even the eagle can be caught by its shadow.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Original wisdom: Knowledge without action is like a river without water.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: The rain does not recognize a king’s palace.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Original African reflection: Strength is measured by how we lift others.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: A fool who walks in the dark is afraid of the night.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Original cultural wisdom: The village that sings together stays together.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: Even a worn-out drum can call the spirits.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Original reflection: Generosity creates wealth that money cannot buy.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: A man who hides from the sun will remain cold.
African.author: African Proverb

African.text: Original African wisdom: The smallest pebble can start an avalanche of change.
African.author: Original African Wisdom

African.text: No one knows the strength of a tree until it falls.
African.author: African Proverb
